headline: Mediocre at best. Covid and bad management have destroyed the company.
pros: Nothing as such. Highly team and manager dependant work, leaves etc.
cons:
Quality of work is mostly very bad. Since 40% (and only increasing) employees have left in Covid, main job of new joiners is to cover up for them like debug their code etc. 

Too much attrition. Almost half the company has left. Just see how many ex-MMT employees are in Amazon on LinkedIn. That's how bad the company is people prefer to move to Amazon. Underpaid, overworked.

Company is in the phase of extreme cost cutting. That's why even in Covid they were in profit with such less revenue compared to before Covid when they were not in profit with triple the revenue. (check MMYT quarterly revenue and profit on NASDAQ for last 2 years). So focus is on cost-saving not quality.

Open leave policy totally manager dependant. Some managers don't let you take leaves at all. It's better to have a counted number of leaves.

Highly understaffed. Don't follow SDLC principles at all. Improper and manual testing. Also no proper guidance since almost half the company has left. 

Toxic culture. Most of what you read here is a lie trust me. No one is satisfied here. People here use sir & mam for most senior staff which is very rare to find in respected firms.

headline: SSE II at Bangalore Development Center
pros:
HR:
They are very good at what they do and are responsive. During my hiring process they offered great support and guidance. They were always there when I felt lost or needed help.

Engineering:
Fundamentally, the company has a service oriented architecture (SOA) for its internal software systems.
I had a good number of project opportunities and got exposed to important technologies such as Java EE, Spring, & Couchbase. This list has been growing as I explore new projects here.
Initially I worked on a brand new project, which helped me learn to develop a web service from scratch.
I also got to be involved in technology migration activities, which helped me understand the differences and nuances between old and new technologies.
There has been an increased focus on software quality by incorporating tools such as Sonar.

Team:
My team is brimming with experienced engineers: Senior Software Engineers and Tech Leads. We all have similar experience and mindset and come from diverse backgrounds. Working with them helped us establish professional friendship - we help each other out when needed.
More importantly, there are highly experienced engineers as well - Principal engineers & Architects. Working with them has been a great source of learning and inspiration.

Management:
Senior technology management is easily accessible and has provided good direction when needed.
There are various internal tools that one can use to effectively communicate with senior business management as well for any other concerns.

Benefits:
Annually an offsite trip is funded by the company, where a team can go on a vacation trip to a place of choice.

Work-life balance:
I have worked at a different e-commerce company before. Basis that I would like to comment that the work-life balance at MakeMyTrip is good.
In fact, it ranked #1 recently in work-life balance of all the e-commerce companies in India.
cons:
I can't think of a con from the top of my head, maybe because I was satisfied with the pros here.

Having said that, working here has been a learning curve for me and so there have been mostly ups, but also occasional downs at times.

headline: MakeMyTrip in real screws your Professional Trip.
pros:
There are definitely strong reasons that one should consider working here, such as:
1) Good Pay Master.
2) Brand Name.
3) They make you work a lot, which can in-turn help you learn a lot.
4) At times internally, being an employee of this company you get to know good airfare/packages deals, etc. which might help  you, your friends and family to plan trips at cheaper rates.
5) Infrastructure is good.
cons:
There are multiple reasons that could be stated here from the experiences I've personally had, though will in general share a few of them:
1) Lots of Internal Politics starting from lowest Manager level.
2) Partiality and Favoritism of Bosses is the "Key to Success" here among each and every department of MakeMyTrip.
3) Your hard work, stretching for long hours, coming on weekends for work, won't make any difference at all, in the eyes of your Manager, as that is all going to go in vain at the time of Yearly review. As your KRA's are just set as a part of the process to complete the formality, but, nothing else, they won't make any difference when it actually has to be discussed at Year end, it can either be changed anytime during the year without your information, or you can accept to hear strange ways to measure it or compare it with others in team, not told to you at the time of KRA setting, which will fade off/nullify your entire work done throughout the year.
4) Bad working culture prevails here, especially for Females, such as, Managers prefers for Evening dinners with teams, instead of Day-time lunches, which is always convenient for all girls in the team, on the contrary girls are forced to join them for such events. Drinking a lot and loosing control after that is a very common scene here at Office Parties. Use of abusive language among males is a frequent sight in office hours & premises. If you wear formal to work place, you would be made fun off, with comments such as ("where are you going for an interview today?"). Managers tries to be overly interested/poking in whats going on in your personal life, and if you are not of the same nature, and have your own set of family values and work-ethics you will have a tough time working here, else be a part of his/her gang, and be happy. Managers will ensure round the year he/she keeps  you insecure about your Job, and no matter how much efforts you are putting in, or have actually shown results, you can be asked to leave anytime with vague reasons given to you, as compared to those members of your team, who rarely work, but, know how to please there Boss. Huge monetary contributions can be a regular ask here for events day-in and day-out, like somebody's B'day, marriage, offsite contributions for drinks and non-veg food etc. (even if you don't drink or eat non-veg), and if you are not comfortable for contributing in it, your manager will ensure to taunt you for such things publicly every-time and make you feel awkward and look-down upon yourself, that you can't afford such expenses etc.
5) Higher Management is not at all supportive, rather very diplomatic and manipulative, if you reach out to them for help, don't expect anything from them, or any understanding but, sweet talks and sympathetic replies in return.
